overview_of_class:
Intermediate Studio: architectural and structural design of a building project with multiple requirements.

The program will focus on integration of design + engineering, design methods, history, creative thinking, and research while requiring students to realize designs individually as well as working in teams. The program seeks to reinforce creative engineering for future engineers or lead to a Masters in Architecture at an Architecture Graduate Program. This is the Second Quarter of the three course studio series.
name: Architectural Engineering and Design 2: Intermediate
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 385-2-20 Architectural Engineering and Design 2: Intermediate
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Engineering Juniors or Seniors.
Add Consent: Department Consent Required

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Intermediate Studio: architectural and structural design of a building project with multiple requirements.

The program will focus on integration of design + engineering, design methods, history, creative thinking, and research while requiring students to realize designs individually as well as working in teams. The program seeks to reinforce creative engineering for future engineers or lead to a Masters in Architecture at an Architecture Graduate Program. This is the Second Quarter of the three course studio series.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Junior standing in engineering and 385-1. By permission number only.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The goal of this program of Design Studio/Seminars/Research is to give students a strong, comprehensive and broad understanding of architecture, design, and engineering in the context of our present world.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Steve Jobs / Walter Isaacson / ISBN 978-1451648546 / 2013 / Simon & Schuster

subject: CIV_ENV
